alert.note: Alert for Lehigh (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 06 at 3:49PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east central Pennsylvania...including the following county...Lehigh. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 348 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding across portions of the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Northampton, Coffeetown, Neffs, Schnecksville, Coplay, and Hokendauqua. - This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 60 and 66. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
